head.supplied: Melb. bot Garden ¶ 11/2/69 ¶ ¶ Your excellent son, dear Mr Guilfoyle, having lately returned from the S. Sea Islands so loaded with treasures, it occurred to me, that possibly in some instances you m...

div.p: RB MSS 439c, Library, Royal Botanic Garden, Melbourne.

Your excellent son, dear Mr Guilfoyle, having lately returned from the S. Sea Islands so loaded with treasures, it occurred to me, that possibly in some instances you might have far more spare plants than you could dispose of. If so I should be very glad to effect interchanges & could offer many rare American Pines, American Oaks, Walnuts, Hickories, Himalaian Pines, Mediterranean Oaks &c. I could also send you Mauritius fern tree-plants two feet high.
Any thing from the S. Sea Islands, collected as valuable by your son, would be welcome. No doubt he brought a host of ferns in a growing state, as they travel so well.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: My great distribution takes place already in April. So our interchanges should be made before.
